result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander Robert Boddy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#1 and Ct#2 15CF120

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander Robert Boddy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:04 a.m.  Defendant Alexander Robert Boddy in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 15CF161.  O'Sullivan - filing amended 3 count information.  Guilty to each count, state will dismiss 15CF161, S/W, 2 years probation, expungement, will argue jail time.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.      COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTSConstitutional rights explained to defendant.   O'Sullivan and Loberg - State will file 2nd amended information in 15CF120 and amended information in 15CF161.  Defendant will plead guilty to 2nd amended Counts 1 and 2  in 15CF120 and guilty to amended Count 1 in 15CF161.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count 1 and Count 2 in second amended information in 15CF120 and pleads guilty to Count 1 in amended information in 15CF161.  Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 1 and 2 of second information in 15CF120 and Count 1 in amended information in 15CF161.  Court orders:  S/W, 2 years probation, costs on both cases $443 per conviction, 7 days in Pierce County Jail as conditions of probation, huber allowed.  Expungement upon successful completion.  Jail time to bewgin January 15, 2016  no later than 7:)0 p.m.  Appeal rights are given to defendant.  Home monitoring not allowed.

Information Filed in each case with the Court and a copies are given to the defendant.    Defendant has copy of the information    Defendant waives reading of the information.   DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY to Ct 1, 2, 3 & 4 in 15CF120  .   15CF161  Ct 1 & 2.   DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY Court accepts the pleas. Court reviews the conditions of the bonds.  Set for PTC

3:40 This includes  15CF161.   Defendant Alexander Robert Boddy in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ON BOTH FILES  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.  Court accpets the waiver on each case and binds the defendant over for further proceedings.

4:19 p.m. Defendant Alexander Robert Boddy in court, in custody  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ. Christopher Bub appearing in court with Defendant.   Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.    Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Froelich:  Requests $2,000 signature bond. Bub has no objection to signature bond.  Defendant has not been a member of the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
